summary: This document is an email chain from July 2019 regarding the status of inmate Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. It details his complaints of physical ailments (numbness, sleep apnea), his psychological observation status, and the plan to return him to the Special Housing Unit (SHU). The email shows staff monitoring his condition and managing his housing.

events.title: Epstein's Medical Complaints
events.description: Epstein complained of numbness in his right arm and neck, and a running toilet in his cell. A nurse saw him.

events.title: Plan to Return Epstein to SHU
events.description: Epstein, after receiving his CPAP machine for sleep apnea, was scheduled to be returned to the Special Housing Unit (SHU) with a cellmate, despite his request to remain in a 'safe' area.

keyFacts: On July 28-29, 2019, Jeffrey Epstein was in custody at MCC New York and was on psychological observation.
Epstein complained of physical issues including numbness in his right arm and neck, and attributed memory impairment to sleep apnea, for which he was to receive a CPAP machine.
Epstein expressed a desire to remain in a 'safe' area (likely the hospital/SW area) but was told he would be returned to the SHU (Special Housing Unit) with a cellmate.
Prison staff assessed him as psychologically stable and determined there were no mental health issues precluding his return to the SHU.
